title: Digits
content: Generalization of ~ df-bits . In contrast to ` digit `, ` bits ` are defined for integers only. The equivalence of both definitions for integers is shown in ~ dig2bits : ` ( ( K ( digit ` 2 ) N ) = 1 <-> K e. ( bits ` N ) ) `.

blocks.content: Extend class notation with the class of the digit extraction operation.
blocks.origin: const class cdig { digit }

diff.cdig.c
diff.cdig.w
df-dig
blocks.content: Definition of an operation to obtain the ` k ` th digit of a nonnegative real number ` r ` in the positional system with base ` b ` . ` k = - 1 ` corresponds to the first digit of the fractional part (for ` b = ` 10 the first digit after the decimal point), ` k = ` 0 corresponds to the last digit of the integer part (for ` b = ` 10 the first digit before the decimal point). See also ~ digit1 . Examples (not formal): ( 234.567 ( digit `` 10 ) 0 ) = 4; ( 2.567 ( digit `` 10 ) -2 ) = 6; ( 2345.67 ( digit `` 10 ) 2 ) = 3. (Contributed by AV, 16-May-2020.)
